intro: Anemopaegma chrysoleucum, commonly known as the golden-white anemopaegma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellowish-white composite flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed beyond its native range.
